contextId.occurrenceNote: The words "wept" and "cried loudly" mean basically the same thing and emphasize how much David mourned for Abner. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: The king wept and cried loudly

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "the people of Yahweh" and "Israel" mean the same thing. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: over the people of Yahweh, over Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "house" represents David's descendants, who will rule as kings. Here "kingdom" means about the same thing as "house." This can also be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "You will live to see me establish your family and their rule over the people of Israel forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Your house and kingdom will be confirmed forever before you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Both the phrase "went in to her" and the phrase "lay with her" refer to David having sexual relations with Bathsheba and emphasize what they did. Alternate translation: "had sexual relations with her" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
contextId.glQuote: went in to her and lay with her

contextId.occurrenceNote: These words have basically the same meaning and are used together to emphasize that his case is good. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])
These words mean basically the same thing and are used together to emphasize how weak David was. Alternate translation: "weak" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]])

Both of these phrases means to destroy. In the first phrase "destroying" is spoken of as if it were "swallowing." These may be combined. Alternate translation: "ruin or destroy the city" or "destroy" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublet]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
